Job_Descriptions: Regional Diversity & Inclusion Manager Exciting opportunity to join one of the leading FMCG companies in hyper growth phrase Circa: SGD$130,000 per annum, excluding attractive bonus About our Client We are delighted to partner exclusively with a prominent FMCG client where they have undergone high growth across their Asia Pacific markets. Job Description Reporting to the Regional Talent Director, the Diversity & Inclusion Manager will be responsible to drive corporate D&I programmes, including collaboration with Global D&I committee on any global initiatives, partnership with regional HR Directors and Partners to craft and drive be-spoke D&I topics and roadmaps, and build D&I awareness across all levels through various communication channels. The Successful Candidate To succeed in this role, you should have at least eight years of experience in driving and developing D&I topics and engagements, and a strong foundation in the complexities of D&I topics, preferably within high growth organisations. You are a team player who can work in a flexible and agile environment; you possess strong communication and interpersonal skills to communicate your ideas and programmes in a clear and concise manner across all levels of management. Most importantly, you must display a clear passion and enthusiasm for D&I topics and its importance. What's on Offer Our client has been one of the leading players in their sectors, credited to a highly agile commercial leaders and HR organisations where they have a strong pulse on the markets and its potential. They strongly believe that D&I will continue to play a significant role as part of talent retention and attraction as Asia Pacific continues to grow, especially in markets where talents are sought after. Our client, a leading investment management firm with a growing presence across the region, is looking to appoint a new HR Business Partner to join their HR team in a fully HR Generalist role, based in the Singapore office. You will be operating in a broad HR Generalist position in a highly visible role, working as part of a small and close-knit team to support business leaders across Asia with all HR and People related matters. Reporting into a Senior HR Business Partner, and working closely with the Regional Head of HR, you will be responsible for managing and supporting annual HR processes and projects. You will operate as the key point of contact for your assigned business areas (investments and infrastructure) regarding ongoing HR Advisory and queries, building excellent relationships with your key stakeholders. You will manage employee relations and health and wellness initiatives as well as DEI and Talent Projects. You will partner closely with the business on Talent Acquisition requirements end-to-end, from attraction to offer management and onboarding, supported by an HR Coordinator. You will also drive talent management processes including designing succession and promotion plans, and support employee development as well as supporting annual salary and bonus reviews for your client groups. Ideally, you will be currently operating in a HR Business Partner role with another global investment management or financial services organisation in a broad business facing, strategic and operational position. You will be comfortable navigating performance driven global matrix structures, as well operating in a smaller, high touch and growing organisation, with a focus on collaboration and quality deliverables. You must have the ability to engage with stakeholders at varied levels spread across the region, building strong working relationships across the business. You are a team player with excellent consultative and interpersonal skills. The organisation has an excellent reputation in the market for being values driven, with a strong leadership team and a history of success! They are looking for someone who wishes to stay and grow with the organisation as they continue to build out the region. If you are a HR Generalist (Associate / Senior Associate) or HR Business Partner with a generalist remit looking for an opportunity to join a high performing and driven HR team with the ability to add value from day one, then please apply today to find out more! Critical: HR Generalist and / or HR Business Partner experience in a fast paced, high touch and ideally international financial services and / or professional services organisation. Location: Singapore Thanks for your time. Please apply to find out more about this role, or if you are open to other HR opportunities and want to discuss the market. The Team Investment Technology is one of the most sought-after capabilities in Schroders Global Technology Team. APAC investment technology team develops and supports applications used by regional/global front office business users (Fund Manager/ Product Managers / Risk Managers / Fund Performance Managers and Compliance Managers). The team supports business users in 10 countries, 7 in APAC (Singapore, Hong Kong, Japan, Korea, China, Taiwan, Indonesia and Australia) and Luxembourg, UK, US. As the Analyst Developer at Schroders, you are a core member of the capability aligned agile delivery team, responsible for all aspects of the analysis, design, development, building and testing of solutions. You will contribute to the software development and engineering tasks, particularly technical design, business users’ engagements, coding, and testing. What you’ll do Your key responsibility will be software development and engineering tasks which includes contributing to the analysis and testing of working software required by the Capability [Product] Owner Accountable for ensuring user stories are delivered to the ‘working system’ definition of done within agreed sprint Accountable for ensuring committed PI Objectives and Sprint Objectives are met Working with colleagues from other agile teams and shared service teams to both communicate and accept dependencies Participate enthusiastically and effectively in Schroders Agile ceremonies Ensuring continued improvement through conducting regular retrospective reviews and executing high priority actions that emerge Committing to increasing their skills and experience in non-core specialisms (Analysis, Test) Collaborate with the outsourced offshore development team in India Performing the role of Scrum Master for the agile team if required to do so Writes high quality IT deliverables that have suitable tests. Applies common design patterns to more complex applications Understands code structure, reuse, modularisation, error handling, including software design concepts such as OO, functional, etc. Attends relevant forums, and community groups to learn, share and promote different ways of working and share patterns. Keeps up to date with latest technologies to suggest improvements. What you’ll need At least 5 years of software development experience within financial services either in Asset Management or Investment Banking industry Python development experience and Python library knowledge including packages such as FastAPI and Dash in an enterprise environment Experience with JavaScript programming language and at least one modern JavaScript UI frameworks such as React, Angular etc. used to develop single page applications Experience in developing Cloud native applications like Azure, AWS platforms Experience with both SQL and NoSQL database platforms. Able to work in a modern software engineering environment, using Agile and DevOps methodologies and tools including Scrum, Git and CI/CD Familiarity with Agile delivery methodologies (SAFe is preferred) Wide experience of software development across several different capabilities, systems, or teams; number of different (positive) experiences is valued higher than length of experience Experience of working with global colleagues and stakeholders and sensitivity to cultural differences, time zones etc Good understanding of the business context of the Capabilities Good technical skill using development tools, frameworks, and programming languages, specifically required for delivery Competent with software designs principles such as SOLID, DRY, KISS, etc. What you’ll be like Passionate about mastering and innovating best practice in software development Inspiring and collaborative team member, model of agile leadership approach Friendly, approachable, enjoys working with people from a variety of backgrounds Capable of remaining positive when under pressure Continuous improvement mind-set, challenges the status quo and seeks self-improvement Problem solver, comfortable taking the initiative in challenging and ambiguous circumstances Schroders is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications regardless of sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age. The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for digital infrastructure that supports the Whole-of-Government (WOG). We are the infrastructure architects and engineers who architect, design and deliver an agile, secure and sustainable infrastructure which enables a digital government for Singapore. How we work Aside from formulating the infrastructure strategy and roadmap at WOG level, we also develop prototypes using new technologies and establish standards to guide the design and implementation of information systems that support the enterprise infrastructure. We examine factors such as people, culture, policies and processes to provide a secure, predictive and always-on platform, enabling public officers to work anywhere and anytime. By using innovative Cloud and SaaS technologies, we architect, design, build and deliver Cloud and Datacentre hosting environments and common services which support government agencies in accelerating and developing modern applications and services. Redefining ICT infrastructure through modernisation and automation is also our key focus. Using the latest technology and best practices, we deliver secure and utility-based services to WOG, so that government agencies can function efficiently and seamlessly. We are also passionate about building and uplifting ICT engineering know-how for the WOG in critical infrastructure domains, which we advance through experimentation, prototype development, consultancy and training. Job Overview As a Data Engineer, you will be part of the data analytics team to modernise and streamline the Whole-of-Government (WOG) Infrastructure using data to provide insights needed for evidence-based decision-making and improving the delivery of WOG services. You will be architecting, designing, building and operating the next-generation data infrastructure to galvanise digitalisation in the public sector. You will collaborate with peers such as product manager, data analyst Hadoop system engineers, software engineer to conceptualise the data pipeline to provide data driven insights for users from Whole-of-Government (WOG). What to expect Involve in the design and building of resilient and efficient data pipelines for both batch and real-time streaming data Involve in the architecture, design, implementation and maintenance of data infrastructure using industry standard infrastructure-as-a-code tools Build and implement framework to resolve data problems at scale Mange the continuous testing and development of data pipeline, new data sources and analytic dashboards. Execute projects with Agile methodologies Collaborate with product managers, software engineers and data analysts to build scalable and data-driven platforms and tools How to Succeed Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or have equivalent professional experience Have at least 2 years’ experience in python and SQL Passion for problem-solving, improving and/or implementing processes Experience implementing batch and streaming data pipelines. Experience in handling Warehouse operation data Knowledge of both SQL and NoSQL databases, including performance tuning and troubleshooting. Familiar with DevOps tools such as Git, Docker, Terraform High analytical ability - critical and logical thinking and optimization. Ability to deliver on timelines and move quickly with multi-functional teams to execute on decisions while maintaining attention to details Team player with strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. Experience in the public sector is an advantage Knowledge in SCRUM or DevOps. Knowledge of ITIL processes and procedures.

Job Overview As an Infrastructure and Operations Engineer, you will be part of team to manage the Government IT support infrastructures and services. You will work within a team of engineers with strong technical competency to conceptualise, implement and manage the Government IT support infrastructure and services and ensuring high levels of availability, performance, security and good user experience across the Whole-of-Government (WOG). What you will be working on: Manage multiple vendors that provide IT support services to all Singapore government agencies, in ensuring delivery of contractual deliverables and good user experiences. Plan and assist Agencies to transit to new IT support services Establish and review procedures and processes to govern the provisioning of IT services by the contractors. Conduct audits on contractor’s premises and IT supporting infrastructure. Work with the contractors on service improvement plan. Review the design of the contractors’ premises and IT support infrastructure to ensure compliance with policies and meeting of contract requirement. Project manage to ensure the implementation of contractors’ premises and supporting infrastructure to meet the project milestones. Conduct reviews on architecture, capacity of infrastructure, contractors’ performance and SLA. Conduct briefings to Agencies, crafting of Electronic Direct Mail (EDM) and newsletters on new IT support services and changes. Review deployment plan for new central products and services to ensure support by the service contractors. Participate and contribute in new central product or enhancement projects. Explore new solutions and technologies, integrate learning and recommendations for operational efficiency and continual improve of IT support services for better user experience What we are looking for: At least 4 years of proven experience in vendor management and IT service management, to manage vendors in meeting contract deliverables, compliance with policies and service improvement Technical skills and proven experience in a wide spectrum of IT infrastructure and technologies, in at least four of the following: IT Service Management system i.e. ServiceNow Digital Experience Monitoring tool i.e. Nexthink, Aternity Basic technical knowledge in Cloud Services i.e. Google, AWS and Azure Basic knowldge in businesss analytics tools i.ei Tableau, Qilk Security knowledge in securing both logical (access rights) and physical infrastructure (data centre) Privileged account management ie. CyberArk, CA Privileged Identity Manager Monitoring system i.e. Solarwind, BMC, NetScout Experience in IT support with chatbot and digital guide (i.e. WalkMe or equivalent) is preferred -Knowledge of ITIL processes and procedures -Project management skills with proven experience to manage a project plan, track milestones, identify dependencies and consistently complete the project on time and within budget -Possess the following soft skills and attributes: -Able to work independently and as a good team player with analytical, management and planning skills. -Good written and verbal communication, with the ability to present and communicate effectively with non-technical audience. Dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills. Ability to identity gap in service delivery and make recommendation for improvement. Always keeping up to date of the latest product roadmap and best practices Preferred Certification/Skills Certification in ITIL foundation Certification in Networking and Azure fundamentals We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. Job Overview As a Infrastructure Engineer you will be part of team to implement and manage the Whole-of-Government (WOG) Infrastructure and services, focusing on endpoint and end-user computing (EUC) services. You will work within a team of engineers with strong technical competency to conceptualise, implement and manage the Government infrastructure services and ensuring high levels of availability, performance and security across the Whole-of-Government (WOG). You will also collaborate with peers from other disciplines such as software developers, data engineers, UX Designers and Product Managers to design, develop and implement infrastructure products for WOG. What you will be working on: Design, develop, test, implement and operate the proposed endpoint and EUC services. Lead and work with service providers and product principals to manage the endpoint services and ensure efficient operations management and timely incident and problem resolution. Work closely with the infrastructure architects to rationalise the technical design and ensure the solution works well with Government infrastructure, policies, standards and security requirements. Translate the technical solution/design into technical specifications and functional requirements. Lead and work with outsourced service providers and product principals to manage the delivery, operations as well as Tech Refresh for endpoint services such as: Unified Endpoint Management (UEM) Light touch device enrolment (eg, Windows Autopilot, Android Zero Tech, Samsung Knox Mobile Enrolment [KME] Windows Hello for Business for password-less login Endpoint monitoring and analytics Digital Experience Management (DEM) Software deployment using MECM and Intune Azure Conditional Access Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) Advanced Threat Protection (ATP) Data Loss Protection (DLP) Assess the usability of finished infrastructure designs through user testing and feedback, and continually improve infrastructure to enhance user experience. Ensure the operations process and controls are clearly documented and operationalised. Explore new solutions and technologies, integrate learning and recommendations for operational efficiency and continual improve of the infrastructure for better user experience. Plan, design and support Technology Refresh and migration activities for the infrastructure services. Ensure smooth service delivery and implementation within the business context. What we are looking for: At least 2 years of experience in the above domain areas Proven planning, implementation and migration experience on endpoint or EUC services Team player with strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. Knowledge in SCRUM or DevOps. Knowledge of ITIL processes and procedures. PowerShell scripting is a bonus. Possess the following soft skills and attributes: Ability to justify new initiatives and recommend new initiatives to stakeholder(s) Conceptualise the Concept of Operations for the new initiatives Familiar with tendering process, defining requirements in tender specification Team player and able to lead discussions between internal teams (Operations, Security, Contract) and external product principals or system integrator Requires minimal supervision from supervisor Always keeping up to date of the latest product roadmap and best practices Define policies and procedures related to Endpoint Management. Good written and verbal communication, with the ability to present and communicate effectively with non-technical audience. Provide inputs to optimise and automate workflows and processes Able to work independently and as a good team player with analytical, management and planning skills Dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills. Preferred Certification/Skills Certification in Networking and Azure fundamentals Certification in ITIL foundation Certification in device management service such as Intune, etc We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. What we are looking for: Track record in delivering and implementation of technical solutions. Pro-active, dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills. Able to work independently and as a good team player with analytical, management and planning skills. Job Purpose Reporting to the Head, HR PMO & Change Office, this role is to lead and support the HR Portfolio Management Office, including embedding new Ways of Working Standards (nWOWS) across HR. The HR PMO is also responsible for driving submissions for the HR Management Business Reviews (MBRs), Investment prioritisation and other strategic deliverables. The Role Responsibilities Key responsibilities include: Support an effective Portfolio Management Office, including development and implementation of a robust governance framework for the commissioning, implementation, and review of key investment programmes in line with Group standards. Support strategic submissions for Group and HR MT, including MBR and Investment prioritisation. Support the QPR processes under nWOW. Job_Title: Chief Technology Officer, Pegasus Venture - SC Ventures
Job_Descriptions: SC Ventures (SCV) spearheads the bank&rsquos innovation across the Group. Included in SCV&rsquos mandate will be to invest in FinTech&rsquos and other start-up companies, promote rapid testing and implementation of new business models. SCV will work with businesses and functions across the Group in three key areas of eXellerator, investments, and Ventures. Chief Technology Officer (&ldquoCTO&rdquo) for Project Pegasus (the &ldquoVenture&rdquo) ideally operates out of Singapore focused on taking into production the technology stack, product roadmap, engineering team, and solution delivery for a M&A Deal Origination Platform (the &ldquoPlatform&rdquo). Required experience in front-end AngularJS, and good to have familiarity with modular frameworks such as ASP.NET Boilerplate, ASPNetZero, ABP.IO Overseeing scrum teams, engineers, and ensuring reliable delivery of sprints, change management of features and bug fixes, and backlog. The Role Responsibilities This role is part of the Standard Chartered HR COO Function and focuses on supporting the HR Service Excellence strategy and related projects. As we move forward in a digital and hybrid working world, it is imperative that we continue to deliver excellence customer service to all our colleagues while balancing that against an efficient and effective delivery and operating model across our HR products, service delivery teams and central hubs. New technologies, platforms, processes and systems are meaningless without the capability to leverage them to the fullest. This role will ensure the right focus on upskilling and redesigning the HR delivery functions as it is HR delivery teams who are truly impacting and delivering the customer experience. Job_Descriptions: Position Overview Details of the Division and Team: Deutsche Bank's Wealth Management business is one of the largest wealth managers worldwide. We offer our clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Wealth Management. As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations, we create lasting value for clients. Role Description The Global Payroll Director for Asia/MEA position is responsible for the processing payroll in Asia and MEA regions for 44 countries and over 41,000 employees. The Payroll team is structured geographically, partnering closely with HR, Compliance & Privacy, and IT to ensure Microsoft employees are paid accurately and on-time. This position is required to oversee the execution of the processes and agreements with the Business Process Outsource (BPO) Provider, Controller Community and payroll support functions for these regions. This person is ultimately responsible for the management of the deliverables of the BPO SLA, while ensuring Sub & Employee satisfaction on all levels relating to Payroll Services, as well as budgetary responsibility for the region. This role will lead a team of 8 direct reports with a growth mindset culture that values diversity & inclusion, customer obsession, attention to detail, and operational excellence. The role is part of the Finance Operations team and partners with other members (internal stakeholders and designated vendors) to shape the organization priorities and people initiatives. This position will report to the Senior Director for Global Payroll. Responsibilities People Management Managers deliver success through empowerment and accountability by modeling, coaching, and caring. Model - Live our culture Embody our values Practice our leadership principles. Coach - Define team objectives and outcomes Enable success across boundaries Help the team adapt and learn. Care - Attract and retain great people Know each individual's capabilities and aspirations Invest in the growth of others. Process Management Completes end-to-end payroll processing within and cross countries of the Asia Pacific, Middle East, and African regions. Provides ongoing support of complex issues. Resolves roadblocks independently or with the team. Contributes to the global definition of delivery model. Builds a business case for long-term process improvements or within the business. Continuous Improvement Solicits feedback from internal and external business partners to manage gaps in service and develops and implements action to remediate. Drives and empower the team to target global processes, creates improvement plans with relevant stakeholders, and executes activities to improve, standardize, or automate processes. Directs and oversees changes across all stakeholders. Oversees the creation, review, and approval of business case proposals for long-term process improvements or within the business. Reporting and Analytics Empowers, develops, coaches, and manages the team around reporting and analytics. Proposes new or changes to existing Payroll scorecards analytics and reports. Forecasts based on prior trends to predict future business needs. Acts on analytics findings. Identifies future needs to evolve process and solutions. Structures and facilitates meetings with senior stakeholders based on scorecard and report results. Identifies needed insights and leading indicators in order to manage operations. Vendor Management Assess vendors at a regular cadence. Reinforces complex global controls when managing multiple vendors who facilitate the payroll process. Reviews vendor performance and solutions offered by other vendors in order to select the best option. Reviews and approves drafted vendor contracts and funding proposals. Assesses vendors and provides feedback regarding service level agreements (SLA) and key performance indicator (KPI) performance exemplified in the reports. Supports ad hoc project work. Assesses vendors at a regular cadence. Communicates future plans with vendors. Stakeholder Management Provides coaching to other Microsoft employees regarding stakeholder management best practices. Identifies strategic stakeholders and establishes trust with upstream and downstream partners. Drives resolutions in processes with upstream and downstream stakeholders. Drive regular rhythm for business reviews with stakeholders focused on sharing results, gaps, issues, and future changes in the pipeline. Engages and influence stakeholders to identify opportunities with a business impact. Compliance, Controls, and Audits Communicates control changes to relevant stakeholders. Ensures controls (e.g., Sarbanes-Oxley [SOX]) are executed timely and correctly. Coaches the team regarding compliance issues. Empowers and coaches team members around Controls and Compliance. Investigates the process to identify issues at the root cause. Partners with controls and compliance teams to determine accuracy of the controls. Ensures the full time employee (FTE) and vendor teams are following the controls processes. Ensures payroll calculations and reporting are compliant with statutory legislation. Identifies risks and elevates to leaders in order to mitigate the risk. qualifications required/minimum qualifications 8+ years of payroll operations experience in an enterprise-d company and 5+ years of people management experience bachelor's degree or equivalent in accounting, finance, business administration, hr or related field shared services experience in a regional leadership role fluent in english or equivalent experience. additional or preferred qualifications international working experience (statutory, regulatory and cultural) fluent in one or more regional languages, mandarin a plus

Job_Title: Senior Azure Customer Engineer (FastTrack for Azure - Apps)
Job_Descriptions: Are you an engineer or architect who is passionate about cloud application engineering & architecture? Do you enjoy building, designing scalable solutions and enabling customers / partners to build and deploy them? Are you intrigued by new technologies and how can they be applied to solve for real-world problems our customers and partners? If the answer is yes, we are looking for Apps Engineers like you to work with us in FastTrack for Azure, a part of Azure Customer Experiences Team in Microsoft. Azure Customer Experience (CXP) team is a growing Engineering team of customer obsessed & passionate individuals that drive positive customer outcomes and experiences. FastTrack for Azure (FTA) is a customer success service to help customers confidently onboard to Azure and getting them on the right track to "build it right, architect it right, the first time". FTA takes a solution-centric approach and provides customers with Engineering resources, best practices, tools, and resources that drive Azure usage. Are you interested in working for one of the most exciting products in Microsoft, passionate about exceeding customer expectations and advancing Microsoft's cloud first strategy? Are you interested in a start-up like environment, passionate about cloud computing technology and driving growth in one of Microsoft's core businesses? If so, then look no further than the Azure Customer Experience Team! Microsoft Azure provides customers with on-demand and infinitely scalable infrastructure and platform for customers to build, host, and scale service applications on the Internet through Microsoft's global data centers. As a customer engineer, you will primarily be working with customers in providing guidance & sharing best practices to ensure reliable, scalable, secured and cost optimized deployment of their applications on Microsoft Azure. Some of the key responsibilities will include: You MUST be a lifelong learner capable of continuously learning new technologies. Directly engage with customers and partners to validate newly designed Solution and existing Solutions for migration & modernisation, partner with other Customer Engineers to provide end to end guidance Accelerate the customer projects to production Partner with FTA Program Managers in helping them scope pre-qualified complex projects Provide knowledge and insight to build the customers confidence. Identify common patterns from your engagements and work with a thriving FTA community of Engineers to share best practices & learnings at scale Drive product improvement by capturing product-related feedback that the relevant Product teams can triage Contribute to documentation through sample scripts, blogs, architecture best practices. Be a leader for junior engineers across Asia Contribute to the broader FTA team across Asia skills listed below can help in being successful in this role, we don't expect you to have all of them and we seek individuals who are excited about this role and love to learn what's required. technical experience overall cloud fundamentals such as governance, monitoring & security with respect to app technologies design & deploy high level solution architectures including basics of infrastructure & applications on cloud or an understanding how application components fits into the overall solution experience with and ability to lead customers with two or more of the following: application modernisation using azure technologies such as (app service, storage, ase, cdn) containers on azure (aks, aci, acr) integration using azure integration services (apim, functions, service bus, logic aps, event grid etc) application specific usage of data services (sql, cosmosdb, table storage, redis) application security on azure (waf, frontdoor, private networking, sentinel) oss on azure familiar with one of the modern programming languages such as c#, go, java, or javascript etc. familiar with the devops practices and experience with the tooling such as azure devops, github actions, arm templates or terraform etc. customer facing experience creating & validating requirements and guiding architectural decision making with customers effectively driving recommendations and land priorities across customers, partners, senior executives across organizational boundaries leading projects, consulting and/or delivery experience leading technical conversations, bringing in & leveraging relevant technical expertise from other teams working with enterprise customers on cloud specific data solutions, application development & deployment highly regarded but not essential bi-lingual skills with english and mandarin/cantonese/malaysian/indonesian singapore/korean/malaysian government/security clearance ability to meet microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. these requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: microsoft cloud background check: this position will be required to pass the microsoft cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. the successful candidate must be able to legally work in singapore.

Job_Title: Account Executive (Indonesia market - Bahasa speaking) - Tableau
Job_Descriptions: Job Category SalesJob Details About Tableau, a Salesforce company Tableau helps people see and understand data. Our analytics platform fuels exploration, allowing you to quickly answer questions with data and share insights across your organization. Global enterprises, early-stage startups, nonprofits, and governments all use Tableau's intuitive software to quickly transform their data into actionable insights. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world! What you'll be doing… The Account Executive is responsible for driving sales of Tableau products within the Small and Medium d businesses (SMB). This role manages all aspects of the sales process including prospecting, lead management, qualification, product demonstrations, evaluation, close and account care. This is a quotacarrying sales position that requires a high volume of activities and plays an integral role in the success of the overall sales team. Some of the things you'll be doing include … Define and execute territory sales plans and then meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities within the SMB business. Develop and manage sales pipeline - prospect and assess new sales potential while moving a large number of transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline Conduct a high-volume of activities with customers including calls, emails, demos, webinars Manage and track customer and transactional information in a CRM system Coordinate resources throughout the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering Provide initial product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers Provide regular reporting of pipeline and forecast through the CRM system Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products Practice effective, excellent communication with management, customers and support staff Participate in teambuilding and companygrowth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and customer care. Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts. Who you are… Experienced. You have at least 3+ years of direct sales experience, preferably in high volume, transactional sales of technology or services in Indonesia. Amazing Salesperson. You have a desire, even an obsession, to bring / expand customers into the Tableau franchise and maximize revenue. You have the ability to develop and manage a sales pipeline with a proven track record of handling and closing a large number of transactions simultaneously. Technically Savvy. You don't shy away from opportunities to get into technology - and you can learn it quickly. Go-Getter. You are willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic self-directed and resourceful. Mission-Driven. You "get it" and understand Tableau's mission deeply in some way. You believe Tableau will become one of the most important technology companies in the world, you want to be a contributing member of a winning sales team, and you want to have fun all the way. Effective Communicator. You are clear and persuasive in verbal and written English and Bahasa Indonesia communications with highly effective use of email and telephone. Cross-Cultural. You have experience relating to customers from a variety of countries. You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world. Tableau will operate independently under the Tableau brand, driving forward a continued focus on our mission, our customers and our Tableau Community. Hiring_Company: Applied Materials South East Asia Pte Ltd
Job_Descriptions: Job Title: Product Development Senior Manager (M5) Veranome Biosystems LLC, an Applied Materials company, provides the spatial analysis market with a reliable, easy-to-use, end-to-end multi-omics solution. We enable researchers to deepen their understanding of diseases with high-quality data of how individual cells organize within tissue, using robust workflows, reliable imaging systems and without the need for extensive bioinformatics tools or infrastructure. Veranome's unique combination of genomics expertise and world-class high-speed diffraction limited optical imaging capabilities enables researchers to access in-situ spatial omics and elucidate reliable disease insights with unsurpassed data quality. Job Summary: While most industries slowed down in response to the global pandemic in 2020, the field of spatial omics only accelerated. This is an exciting time in this field and we're looking for an engineering technical manager to lead the product development team. In this challenging and rewarding career opportunity, you will be responsible for leading the team in instrument development, instrument improvement (CIP work), and managing the overall instrument NPI process. Who you are: You are detailed and process oriented and demonstrate an extensive knowledge and leadership experience in leading product development teams for imaging and/or fluidics hardware work. You have strong project management experience working with various internal teams on the NPI process as well as driving the manufacturing of biotech instruments with external contract manufacturing firms. Who you will work with: Veranome Bio is a fast-paced, purpose driven company that is at the forefront of building a new product category in the genomics space. You'll work with an amazing team of experts as we develop cutting-edge products that unlock the potential of high-plex, subcellular resolution spatial omics. The value you bring + the value you deliver: Your work will be critical in bringing advanced high-content imaging and image analysis from semiconductor optical inspection to high-plex, subcellular resolution spatial omics. You will bring extensive product development knowledge and leadership and in-depth experience working with various contract manufacturing firms for our company to deliver the highest quality products. Key Responsibilities: Lead a product development team to ensure development activities are complete on time. Lead and manage continuous product improvement projects (CIP) for the instruments. Lead New Product Introduction (NPI) activities with representatives from various groups. Lead and coordinate with contractor manufacturers during instrument development, pilot manufacturing, and ramp-up of manufacturing. Work with R&D engineers to introduce improvements to the product line. Identify risks to project success, develop effective action plans for resolution, and appropriately manage / escalate project issues or risks. The position is based in the Singapore and will report to the Engineering Director. Education and Experience: BS or Masters in Engineering with at least 10 years experience in a project/product development role with experiences developing electrical and mechanical systems for the life science sector. Working with optical instrumentation is a strong plus. Key Competencies: Engineering - commanding knowledge and experience with system engineering (electrical and mechanical). Knowledge in optics is a plus. Experience with Systems Integration and product Verification and Validation highly preferred. Familiarity with life science instrumentation design and microfluidics manipulation a plus. Experience with quality regulations and standards (e.g. ISO 13485) is a plus. Ability to coordinate work within a multidisciplinary team. Well-developed documentation and technical report writing skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Fluent in English. Qualifications Education: Bachelor's DegreeSkills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 10 - 15 YearsWork Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 20% of the TimeRelocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

An independent, self-starter who is able to thrive in a fast paced and changing environment.

Job_Title: Credit Data Infrastructure Analyst, Group Credit Analytics, Risk Portfolio Management
Job_Descriptions: Credit Data Infrastructure Analyst, Group Credit Analytics, Risk Portfolio Management Risk Portfolio Management comprises of a broad range of functions primarily focused on credit portfolio management across banking subsidiaries within OCBC Group. These include: Assessing the risk and opportunities in the Bank's key markets and asset classes in the context of the Bank's risk appetite and against economic, structural and cyclical conditions. Determining the risk and opportunities in the Bank's key markets and asset classes in the context of the Bank's risk appetite and against economic, structural and cyclical conditions. Analysing and measuring credit and financial performance of the portfolio from multiple perspectives, including legal entity, business unit, customer segment, product, industry, geography. Identifying trends and drivers, drawing insights and developing management discussion points and recommendations Developing, implementing, and managing the credit risk measurement framework encompassing credit risk scorecards and rating models, risk weighted assets determination, risk measurement data and systems infrastructure, policy and processes, expert guidance to users on usage and interpretation. These frameworks are used in the credit underwriting, customer selection, limit setting, early warning and problem recognition, assessment of capital and provision adequacy internally as well as for regulatory compliance. Managing suite of portfolio dashboards and reports to the Board, senior management, functional risk committees and supervisory authorities. Responsibilities: There is currently a 1-year contract opportunity for a dynamic and motivated individual to join the department. The successful candidate will be part of a team responsible for one or more of the following areas: Focus on the data acquisition and aggregation of credit data for the regulatory and management reporting of the bank's Group portfolios. Support department-led and bank-wide projects, this includes providing user requirements, formulating test plans and participating in UAT, and engaging stakeholders Participate in the maintenance of the credit risk data aggregation processes, which include coding and testing of scripts Qualifications Relevant experience in analytical role in a financial institution Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage internal and external stakeholders Self-motivated and detailed oriented team player who can multi-task in a fast-paced environment Good understanding of banking products and risk management concepts Independent, creative, and pro-active problem-solving mindset Proficient in analytical tools such as SQL/Teradata, SAS, Python and Microsoft Office applications

Job_Descriptions: Senior Associate / Associate, Business Analyst, Transformation Group Business Function: Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the "World's Best Digital Bank" (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Job_Title: Solution Architect (APAC, SOA, Java, Digital Bank) - perm in SG
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Bennie Yeo Principal Recruiter (Program & Change, Banking Tech) View profile & contact Are you exceptional in leading Solution Architecture on a Digital Transformation across APAC in your current Organization? If you have an entrepreneurial and passionate SW Solutioning mindset, this could be the career opportunity for you !! • Onsite Interview Process (Raffles Place) • 50% Travel across APAC (Vietnam, India, Philippines, etc), depending on evolving Covid Travel restrictions As a Solution Architect, it’s your job to ascertain that envisaged solutions become reality. Taking this client-facing role, you are equally comfortable in deep-dive technical workshops and in board-level sales presentations. Having earned your stripes in designing web-based architectures, you have no problem finding the scope in large-scale, complex projects. To the development team, you are the vital mainstay during processes of implementation. To customers and partners, you are the expert liaison with a keen feel for their needs. So besides being a great technician, you are also a considerate companion who delivers remarkable results on a continuous basis. Solution Architect (APAC, SOA, Java, Digital Bank) - perm in SG You will be part of the development team in which you will fulfill a leading role only gained by excellent performance. Talking highly specific technical details as well as discussing general business outcomes, you comfortably translate customer requirements into a distinguished design. You dedicate yourself to security, deployment, performance, caching, sizing, scalability and serviceability. You know our projects are to be delivered according to briefing, time and budget, but you also know our technicians need their space to build the solutions you’ve defined. By creating structure and clear explanations, you provide guidance and oversight to your team. Also part of the job is creating technical architecture documentation; working with the QA lead to define the test strategy; leading DevOps to define and implement CI/CD pipelines; ensuring that implementations meet non-functional requirements, and you will be traveling a significant amount of the time, spending time on-site during the inception phase and when providing training and workshops. In return for this excellent career opportunity, we ask that you have the following: Tertiary Education in a reputable Institution Service Oriented Architectures (SOA), as well as Micro-Services Architecture for Portal/Web Content Management, Integration Platforms, API Gateway JavaScript frameworks, MVC patterns and principles of REST APIs, ideally including RAML and/or OpenAPI, are second nature to you; Best practices experience on Architectural frameworks, Enterprise Integration Patterns & architectural patterns, such as Microservices, CQRS, event sourcing; Broad, operational knowledge of application servers, databases, load balancers and other infrastructure components required to deploy web applications in a highly available and scalable environment Experience with server virtualization and containers technology such as Docker, VMWare, HyperV; Prior experience in Java, Spring, Maven and Jenkins Prior experience Solutioning in complex, cross-functional technology-related projects in digital banking Established experience with SCRUM, different variants of AGILE techniques, along with familiarity with code management and Continuous Integration/Delivery Implementation (CI/DI). Robust stakeholder management skills and good interpersonal skills Ability to demonstrate conceptual thinking skills Can work confidently and collaboratively with cross-functional stakeholders of varying seniority Organized with a natural inclination for planning strategy and tactics Thrive in a fast-paced environment and can adapt to various demands in a diverse culture Has ability to multi-task and meet multiple deadlines If this speaks to you and you are ready for a new challenge, please send your Resume in MS word format to Bennie.Yeo@springasia.com Even if you are not interested, you can still park your CV with us for other Banking IT positions or forward this Advertisement to your counterparts with the relevant Banking IT experiences I am looking for. We Seek to: Understand your personal circumstances, needs and ideals Present your credentials to our clients only with your permission Strategize and consult with you Your application will be kept with the strictest of confidence. Job_Title: VP, Senior Digital & Technology Audit Manager (Section Manager), Group Audit
Job_Descriptions: VP, Senior Digital & Technology Audit Manager (Section Manager), Group Audit OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Audit provides objective assurance that the Group functions effectively to accomplish its objectives within the established risk appetite. We adopt a risk-based systematic approach to evaluate and provide recommendations to improve the effectiveness of internal control, risk management and governance processes. Key Responsibilities: 1. Assist the Head, Digital & Technology Audit in the delivery of his/ her role and responsibilities. 2. Prepare the audit plan for the areas under his/her charge and monitor the progress/ achievement of the audit plan. 3. Manage a team of Digital & Technology auditors in ensuring that audits are delivered on time, on budget, to the required standard (i.e. audit work meets audit objectives, working papers and reports are adequately prepared) and to provide value to the Bank. 4. Work in conjunction with the Digital & Technology Audit Managers in communicating audit findings and achieving agreement with the audit clients. 5. Develop and maintain: Audit methodology and procedures to provide independent assurance over digital initiatives and technological controls. Knowledge of leading practices and activities of existing and new technology in general. 6. Work in conjunction with the Heads of Group Technology and Group Risk to: Better manage business and Technology, Information and Cyber risks. Maintain a good working relationship. Ensure that Group Audit is kept informed of changes in risk management and/or all major new developments. Track the implementation of audit and regulatory recommendations. 7. Work in conjunction with the other Senior Audit Managers and Head, Digital & Technology Audit to provide the most effective working practices for technology audits. 8. Provide agreed management reports to the Head of Digital & TechnologyAudit 9. Build and develop a team of internal auditors to manage and execute audit engagements with the following minimum skills: Excellent project management. Subject matter experts on framework and methodology. Subject matter experts on various applications or operating systems for mainframe, midrange and open systems, and the corresponding IT activities. Ability to identify technology and information security critical issues as well as opportunities. 10. Responsible for staff performance and career management as well as development plans for team members. Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: University Degree in Computer Science or equivalent and possess Certified Information System Auditor (CISA) or equivalent certifications. Minimum of 12 years' experience in technology audits or equivalent in IT (e.g. applications development/ support, infrastructure projects / support). Experience in managing a team and audit engagements. Good knowledge of various banking applications, operating systems, databases, etc. for mainframe, midrange and/or open systems; with working / auditing experience in at least 1 platform. Strong risk-based audit experience with hands-on experience in analytic/visualization tools such as QlikView and ACL. Independent and committed with high level of initiative. Strong analytical and report writing skills. Strong interpersonal and communications skills. High level of integrity, drive and sense of urgency. Willing and able to operate effectively in a leadership position or a team player. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Clinical Quality Standards & Improvement Sr Exec/ AM/ Manager *Medical*
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : . The Clinical Improvement Manager provides regulatory, education, clinical improvement and informatics support to designated centers. This role is an expert resource and partner providing ongoing support with quality patient outcomes, training and education, and auditing for compliance with policies, procedures and protocols. . The Clinical Improvement Manager will work collaboratively with the Directors, Preceptors, clinical management and their teams to assist and facilitate the implementation process of corporate initiatives, development and implementation of quality improvement plans. . The Clinical Improvement Manager will organize centre outreach activities as identified and prioritized by the team. The Clinical Improvement Manager will serve as support educator and an expert in quality improvement. . Other key responsibilities will include participation in centre quality meetings. . This position offers ongoing support and development for clinical management and Preceptors. . This role is involved in the recommendation process for Preceptor selection, ongoing training and competency check-off and skill development. . The Clinical Improvement Manager provides in-servicing, monitoring and education of all other clinical staff for adherence to current P&P. . The Clinical Improvement Manager also communicates and shares quality improvement best practices in order to meet organizational goals. . You will oversee and administer the organization's clinical risk management programme for the monitoring, reviewing and reporting of risks to assist in identifying and eliminating causes of incidents to prevent recurrence. . Participates in planning and implementation of strategic quality improvement initiatives that will advance organization's objectives. . Develops and supports on-going learning that will help sustain quality. This includes coaching in facilitation and improvement methodologies. . Provides consulting and analytical support to improvement teams in order to achieve performance targets. . Facilitates enterprise-wide and/or entity specific improvement initiatives. Facilitates teams through the full project cycle. . Designs and/or identifies appropriate performance measures to evaluate effectiveness of implemented improvements. . Acts as change agent by promoting use of the Model for Improvement and LEAN as a means of making improvement, encouraging systems thinking, sharing information, providing formal education and just-in-time training. . Collaborates across organization's in the development or revision of policies/procedures/guidelines as applicable to the improvement work. . Supports service improvement by coaching and facilitating discussions to encourage creative thinking and test new ways of service delivery that are patient-centered Requirements: . Min Degree in any field . Experience in front line customer service and Quality Standards and Improvement for 2 years would be at an advantage . Enjoys meeting and helping people . Proficient in MS Office Applications If you are interested in the position, do kindly drop your most updated resume to recruithealth @recruitexpress.com.sg (Attn: Clinical improvement manager) Thank You. Job_Title: AVP, Portfolio Analyst, Group Portfolio Analytics & Reporting (Wholesale)
Job_Descriptions: AVP, Portfolio Analyst, Group Portfolio Analytics & Reporting (Wholesale) OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Risk Management (GRM) is an independent function responsible for ensuring that risk management practices at OCBC Bank are effective and comprehensive. GRM builds and drives the Bank's businesses through an integrated risk management approach relying on strong risk analytics to support strategic business decision-making and to create a competitive edge for the Group. Key Responsibilities: Develop and produce management reporting for the Board Risk and Credit Committees of the Bank on Wholesale portfolio Provide quantitative analysis and translate data into meaningful insights to support Chief Credit Officer and Senior Credit Officers on various industry portfolios Produce the monthly dashboards by various segments to Risk Management and Business Units, provide meaningful analysis and explanations for performance trends in the reports Participate in datamart development project to provide data requirements, work with IT and stakeholders to define test scenarios, conduct UAT and ensure a smooth transition into a new data platform Qualifications The ideal Candidate would meet the following requirements: At least 3-5 years of working experience in the financial industry with direct experience in credit risk management and knowledge of non-retail portfolio is a plus Technical skills (SAS EG/BASE, SQL) and handling of large analytical datasets are preferred Strong analytical, quantitative and computational skills Keen interest and awareness of macro-economic development and emerging risk factors Experience in Qlikview report development Good communication and interpersonal skills Strong sense of responsibility and teamwork Willing to take on new challenges and work in a fast-paced environment. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Vice President, Campaign Management - Global Functions
Job_Descriptions: Vice President, Campaign Management - Global Functions The health and safety of our employees and candidates is very important to us. Due to the current situation related to the Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV), we’re leveraging our digital capabilities to ensure we can continue to recruit top talent at HSBC.  As your application progresses, you may be asked to use one of our digital tools to help you through your recruitment journey.  If so, one of our Resourcing colleagues will explain how our video-interviewing technology will be used throughout the recruitment process and will be on hand to answer any questions you might have. Some careers have more impact than others. If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Global Marketing uses creativity and business flair to help drive top-line revenue growth for our Global Businesses by optimising marketplace opportunities, our brand strength and customer insight. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Vice President, Campaign Management. Principal Responsibilities Drive mass affluent proposition acquisition and wealth sales / volume growth for both globally minded onshore and offshore customers via integrated marketing activities (ATL, BTL, digital, event, partnership) Identify and understand the wealth needs of affluent segment to design and rollout acquisition and wealth marketing campaigns to grow investment uptake of existing and new globally minded customers. Increase consideration and adoption of wealth products amongst existing and new customers through wealth marketing strategy and initiatives delivering increased wealth sales and volume. Drive acquisition of mass affluent proposition for onshore and offshore new to bank customers using both digital acquisition and offline channels Plan, lead and deliver insights-led campaigns and marketing strategies and initiatives in an agile manner to support business priorities and enhance customer journey across all channels.  Identify opportunities to test and learn marketing initiatives, including marketing innovation Discover, identify and understand the full life cycle of the affluent segment and their needs using data analytics to develop marketing initiatives to increase acquisitions, retention, engagement and penetration of affluent segment Work with various creative, media and digital agencies and manage and lead end to end campaign planning, evaluation and reporting Work independently to nurture and manage internal (business, compliance, legal, group communications, direct) and external (agencies, production, partners) stakeholder relationships and ensure alignment with business priorities Requirements Agile and a self-starter with a passion for marketing and/or digital and able to work under pressure with a positive spirit have a performance driven attitude and mind-set with an ability to meet targets and KPIs be a team player yet able to work independently and lead on projects be able to influence, manage and build relationships with multiple stakeholders with the proposed Marketing strategy and plan be creative & innovative with alternate options on delivering an effective Marketing plan be energetic, versatile and be constantly ready to accept to perform duties beyond stated scope have sound knowledge of integrated marketing especially digital and social marketing have offshore marketing knowledge, preferred but not essential To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Job_Title: IT Business Analyst (SAP) supporting Finance with commodity trading MNC
Job_Descriptions: IT Business Analyst (SAP) supporting Finance with commodity trading MNC IT Business Analyst (SAP) supporting Finance with commodity trading MNC Around 5 to 10+ years of BA experience with experience supporting finance function Has experience supporting finance end users. Has some understanding of financial reporting, month end reporting, B/S, P&L etc. Strong on SAP FI/Co. Has SAP Hana experience Our client is a renowned and global Commodity Trading MNC (based in town). This is a 1 year contract that is renewable for good performers. For strong performers, they may be opportunities to be considered for a perm role. The co offers good benefits (e.g. 25 days) and a global MNC work environment. As the IT Business Analyst in this commodity trading MNC, you will be part of the global IM/ IT team supporting global finance/accounting end users You should have hands-on BA experience and has done configuration and testing before in SAP FI/CO systems: What You'll Do as a BA: This role is accountable for the scoping and definition of business and system requirements for multiple lines of businesses, and working with the technical teams (on design, build, configuration & test), to ensure that these are delivered to a high quality to the relevant business teams. You work with developers and project managers in the IM department supporting the global finance/accounting end users. As a BA, you will do scoping, business analysis, system implementation, continuous rollout, testing and support work. Key tasks: •Conduct SAP Project workshop with multiple stakeholders; •Support SAP tickets, Analyse and identify issue root causes, quantify potential business impacts and implement resolutions. •Design process based on the business which meet users expectations. •Make recommendations to stakeholders on process improvement •Implement solutions to better enable the process and reduce level of exposure and risk •Interpret policy and explain why work needs to be completed in a particular manner •Explain how a particular process task needs to be fulfilled •Engage with key stakeholders and understand their process requirements •Perform continuous monitoring reviews to make sure that the process aligns to the overall system •Be able to script and make minor changes to the systems landscape Formal qualifications/ background •An undergraduate qualification (Bachelors degree or equivalent) in the relevant IM discipline. • Min 5 to 10+ years of BA experience with strong SAP FI /CO exp and exp supporting finance/accounting end users in a global MNC environment •SAP Finance/Controlling Certification on ECC/ S4HANA on premise or Cloud. •Strong business analysis and project management skills •High levels of ITIL accreditation •Some Project Management accreditation (Foundation level) Role-specific knowledge: •SAP technology domain knowledge in a CTRM environment • Deep understanding of IFRS and Accounting as a BA supporting the finance endusers. •SAP Finance Accounting and Controling mangement expert experience required; General Ledger plus following functions: Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Management Accounting, Inter-company Accounting, Project System. •Experience in FI/CO integration points with other SAP modules like MM, SD,HR etc. •External System integration/Webservice knowledge, especially SFTP/ webservice knowledge; •SAP share service center design, SAP Finance process segregation. •Aspect/CORE/Webmethods and Veson systems knowledge desirable •SAP Basis/Authorization design desirable •SAP ABAP/Debug knowledge is asset; •Back office and ERP integration •Relevant business process improvement planning • Some basic understanding of trade flows in a commodity envnironment People/soft skills required: •Able to build relationships and foster cross boundary collaboration (local and global interactions) •Able to drive plan delivery, hold people and self to account •Able to set clear direction and priorities, and gain support from others •Able to communicate and collaborate with teams in multiple locations when virtual interactions outweigh face to face contact Posted by : CAP Consulting (EA licence : 14C7175) Caroline Poh (EA registration : R1105649) Ad posted on 18 Jan 2022

Job_Title: VP, Senior Audit Manager, Wealth Management Audit, Group Audit - (210002CK)
Job_Descriptions: OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world’s most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody’s. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World’s Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Audit provides objective assurance that the Group functions effectively to accomplish its objectives within the established risk appetite. We adopt a risk-based systematic approach to evaluate and provide recommendations to improve the effectiveness of internal control, risk management and governance processes. Apart from business unit-specific audit departments, find opportunities within our Regulatory Capital Audit, Credit Risk Review, Investigation, Audit Methodology & Standards and Programme Management Office departments. You'll learn the various facets of banking, sharpen your analytical, problem-solving and communication skills and hone your interpersonal abilities. You'll also get opportunities to work with clients across the globe. Key Responsibilities: Plan and manage audits of Consumer and Private Banking by utilising Group Audit risk based and data driven audit approach in evaluating governance framework, risk management, regulatory compliance processes and internal control systems. Provide value-added opinions and recommendations to improve the design and effectiveness of internal controls, in co-operation with line management. Ensure audit work is completed and documented in accordance with required standards and KPIs. Coach team members during audit engagements, especially those who are more junior/less experienced. Support the Head of Department in the annual risk assessment and audit planning relating to Consumer and Private Banking businesses, including periodic/on-going risk monitoring of the businesses and operations to identify risk areas and emerging risk themes, facilitating timely updates of risk assessment and potential changes to the audit plan. Participate in audit projects and on-going exercise to enhance the Bank’s audit and risk management framework, with specific focus on data analytics and continuous auditing/continuous risk assessment. Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: Ability to work effectively, independently and collaborate well with others as a team leader and as a team member, with the requisite analytical and managerial skills to perform detailed/technical work without losing sight of ‘big picture’ issues. Good audit skills and understanding of all risks and controls relating to Wealth Management (e.g., Anti-Money Laundering and Sales Practices). Excellent interpersonal, communication and report writing skills. 10 years or more of auditing/relevant experience. A high level of integrity, drive and the ability to work under pressure are essential attributes. Data analytics skills would be preferred. Hold a professional qualification (CPA/CA/CIA) and a bachelor degree. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us.*We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Assistant Vice President, Asia Financial Solutions - Sector Coverage
Job_Descriptions: Asia & Oceania Corporate Banking Department - Sector Coverage Team Overview of Division/Department Our Asia Oceania Corporate Banking - Sector Coverage Team (AOCB-SCT) provides sector driven client engagement and Mizuho regional branch support to strengthen Mizuho's product-related businessess in the Asia Pacific. Company Profile Mizuho Bank, Ltd. is a subsidiary of the Japan-based Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. (listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and NYSE) and is one of the largest financial services companies in the world. Mizuho Bank, Ltd. provides financial and strategic solutions for the increasingly diverse and sophisticated needs of its clients with offices located in all the major cities of the world such as Tokyo, New York, London, Hong Kong and Singapore. Job Responsibilities (Internal Corporate Title: Assistant Manager) Your key roles & responsibilities include: Ø Assist sector banker and/or directly provide industry insights and implications mainly to Asia Pacific branches and related HO divisions from in-depth business, financial analysis and strategic discussion with individual companies. Ø Target to meet with relevant parties of Mizuho's customers or prospects to engage in sector driven strategic discussion for business promotion and deal origination. Ø Provide timely industry information and market intelligence by conducting industry portfolio analysis, monitoring, while keeping in touch with industry relevant parties, etc. Ø Support senior sector banker and/or directly support branches and related HO divisions to develop business strategy and/or marketing plan to capture business opportunities. Ø Support senior sector banker and/or directly originate deals by collaborating with other professionals including other SCT, AOCB members, other financial products members and analysts in other regions. Ø Help prepare and/or directly provide sector outlook, forecasts, and analysis on selected industries when requested, and hold industry teach-in or market briefing when appropriate. Ø Help liaise with branches/offices in Asia and Head Office for credit approval related issues when required. Ø Develop new research approaches in order to establish product promotion type of research practice in line with CFAS initiatives. Job Requirements What you should have: At least 3 years of relevant corporate finance analytical experience, having obtained this preferably from an accounting firm or investment bank. Other relevant experiences, such as those obtained from a corporate bank, rating agency, or finance department role in a large corporate or multi-national company will also be considered. Must be comfortable in a largely analytical role, but with the ability to convert the analysis into business ideas / sound advice that would appeal to our corporate clients. Strong knowledge of business portfolio analysis, valuation of companies, and M&A modeling is critical to the role. Must be comfortable and confident in presenting own analysis/ideas to senior management executives of our corporate clients (CFO, Group Treasurer). In addition, the candidate must be flexible to travel to meet corporate clients; The candidate must be a strong team player, with willingness to provide guidance to more junior members of the team; A Bachelor's Degree in Commerce or Finance or related discipline is a minimum requirement for applicants, while MBA or Post-Graduate qualifications in Finance or CFA accreditation would be highly desirable. Knowledge of the power, utilities, renewables and infrastructure sectors is a plus. Join Mizuho Bank, Ltd., in Singapore, and be part of our team, passionate to build the future together. "One MIZUHO: Building the future with you"
