Job_Title: Technology Recruiter (on the job coaching is available, no experience is fine)
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : At Recruit Express, we have many great recruiters. On a daily basis, we engage business leaders and organisations, partnering them to achieve stellar performance and help individuals transform their lives with great career moves. Our success story revolves around putting people at the HEART of our business. While we remain focused on our mission to facilitate the success of our clients in business and enhancing career opportunities of our candidates, the foundation of our success lies in our commitment to the professional development of our own employees. Howyourcareerwouldlook like in Recruit Express Attitude over Experience - We are one of the very few companies that welcome people without prior experience. It is not your experience but your attitude that we are looking for. A great attitude is often infectious in the workplace. You would be working with positive team members, who will influence everyone to achieve and exceed their goals. Teamwork & High Performing Culture - At Recruit Express, we believe very much in teamwork. Our highly positive, collaborative and nurturing environment has often been cited as the reason that our employees enjoy coming to work every day. Methodical coaching/mentoring and career development plan - Today's business landscape is complex and changing. Navigating and manoeuvring it effectively is critical, and a combination of soft and hard skills is often at the heart of this. Having a dedicated mentor providing on the job coaching, usually a person who has more experience, allows you to glean an understanding of the best ways to accomplish this. Fast Track Career - We believe in promoting leadership from within the organisation. Performers with leadership potential can look forward to a fast-track career progression and high growth potential within the Asian markets. The Role of a Technology Recruiter A Technology Recruiter's job is a hybrid role - it is not just about recruitment. It also encompasses business development, account management, marketing, customer service all rolled into one. It is about understanding people's needs and motivations, and managing clients and candidates expectations. It is also about building relationships. A challenging role indeed, but a very meaningful one! Responsibilities Business Development : Initiate a range of business development and marketing activities to build new corporate clients and grow your own client portfolio. Account Management : Manage internal and external stakeholders and clients on their hiring needs. Talent Acquisition : Engage in candidate sourcing activities, such as publishing job advertisements and conducting candidate referrals, to ensure a consistent supply of candidates to meet client's needs. Candidate Management: Manage candidates job needs and expectations, their payroll and employment benefits. Requirements: Minimum Degree in ANY Discipline Applicants with good track record in sports or other co-curricular activities in school will have an added advantage Strong interest in marketing and/or business development with good business acumen Possess enthusiasm and most importantly, passion for people About Us Since 1996, Recruit Express has placed highly-qualified professionals at many Fortune 500 companies in Asia and around the world. From recruiting to on-boarding, our clients enjoy a process-driven, human-centric approach to recruiting and access to a network of top-tier professionals. For the past 20 years, we have enjoyed phenomenal growth. The Recruit Express Group of Companies is a valuable member of the publicly listed HRnetGroup on the Singapore Stock Exchange (SGX: CHZ). At present, we have close to 1,000 employees in the Asia region operating in 13 large cities, and place out more than 40,000 contractor employees every year. Across Asia's entrepreneurial footprint, we are a trusted partner in placing talented technical and non- technical professionals at companies that provide competitive compensation, professional development, reputation and benefits. Our Specializations include: Banking, Finance, Central & Government Services Healthcare & Lifesciences Infocomms and Telecommunications General Recruitment International and Industrial Recruitment The heartbeat of Recruit Express lies in our highly enthusiastic and driven business leaders and recruiters, who are motivated to make a difference in their own career as well as the careers of others. It is our people who had shaped the organisation's culture as a vibrant, nurturing and highly collaborative environment. We celebrate every small win and personal milestone of our people every day. Interested to find out more about the RE journey and be part of our heartbeat ? Connect with us now! Job_Title: VP, System Analyst (Cards Issuing & Acquiring), Cards Technology
Job_Descriptions: VP, System Analyst (Cards Issuing & Acquiring), Cards Technology VP, System Analyst (Cards Issuing & Acquiring), Cards Technology Posting Date: 18-Jan-2022 Location: Alexandra Road, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities UOB is on a journey of transforming overall Transaction Banking Architecture in UOB. This is a multi-year program where in we are transforming core cash management platforms which supports payables, receivables, virtual accounts, escrow servicing, domestic and cross border rails, trade, trust and securities services. The role is specifically focused on building payment rails facilitating cash management. You will be a part of the Architecture, Engineering and DevSecOps team.  From technology perspective you will be given opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies including edge computing, real time data services, model run-time platforms, microservices, micro apps, micro front ends as well as embedding finance into ecosystem and partnerships. If you are someone who is passionate about changing the overall financial services landscape then read on. Partner with and acting as a trusted advisor to stakeholders in both business and IT to assist in defining and delivering high quality digital capabilities Work closely with stakeholders to develop practical roadmaps to move the enterprise towards the future state vision, while taking into account business, technical and delivery constraints Work with development teams closely to improve delivery efficiencies Analyze stakeholder requirements, current state architecture, and gaps to create a future state architecture vision for one or more parts of the enterprise with a focus on reduced complexity, cost efficiencies, reuse, convergence, reduced risk and/or improved business capabilities Define and operate the architecture governance process to ensure change initiatives align to the vision and roadmaps Work closely with other Domain Architects across key initiatives and projects to apply architecture principles and standards, and develop reference architectures and design patterns Communicate the principles, standards, vision and roadmaps to stakeholders and proactively addressing any questions / concerns identified Provide thought leadership on architectural or other topics, developing a forward looking view of current and emerging technologies and their impact on the Enterprise Architecture Embed Platform Thinking in everything Job Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent; Formal architecture certification (TOGAF or equivalent) Functional Expertise Required in at least two of the below domains: Payables and Receivables Treasury Management Account Services Liquidity Management Relationship Based Pricing Demonstrate deep domain expertise in: Architecting, designing and developing large scale Digital Platform Solutions Integration with multiple partners for various functions Migrating from legacy applications to an upgraded solutions. building Workflow and Microservices Working knowledge on Clear to Pay Platform or FIS Open Payment Framework is highly desirable or equivalent market leading payments platform Experience in different payment schemes across ASEAN including ISO20022 Experience in working with SWIFT Knowledge in one of the below SpringBoot SpringBatch Apache Camel Apache Kafka Apache Nifi Any API Platform Relational Database Experience (RDBMS) in one or more of the following: Microsoft SQL Server. Oracle. MariaDB. At least 9 years' experience in Enterprise or Solution Architecture in a large, complex, multi-location, multi-national environment Deep experience delivering mission critical, enterprise scale IT solutions in a heterogeneous technology environment Familiarity with best practice methodologies and tools for the entire solution lifecycle from ideation to requirements, design, development, testing, deployment and operations A deep understanding of all domains of Enterprise Architecture, including the business, data, application, infrastructure and security domains Familiarity with one or more formal Architecture frameworks / methodologies (TOGAF, Zachman, BIAN, etc.) Practical experience in data modelling, object modelling, design patterns and Enterprise Architecture tool or other software modelling tools. Practical experience to use business capabilities model Familiarity with heterogeneous technology platforms such as AS400, Unix/Linux, Windows Comfortable in working in an environment which is vendor-intensive Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills to stakeholders at all levels Ability to communicate complex topics in an understandable way using a level of detail and terms appropriate to the situation Capability to think conceptually and identify patterns across seemingly unrelated situations Must be a good team player and able to drive consensus amongst stakeholders with conflicting viewpoints and objectives Possess strong understanding of business strategies and able to translate them into concrete achievable action plans Can deal with difficult conversations effectively Promotes an environment of learning and development. Join us at GPN and inspire people everywhere to achieve their performance and healthy lifestyle goals! At Glanbia Performance Nutrition (GPN), our mission is to inspire people everywhere to achieve their performance and healthy lifestyle goals! We are a global leader in the performance nutrition industry and have a portfolio of nine brands including Optimum Nutrition (ON), BSN, Isopure, SlimFast, Body&Fit, Nutramino, ABB, Think! and Amazing Grass. Our products are sold in over 130 countries and our brands are in the top three performance nutrition brands in more than 20 countries. We are the fastest growth driver within the Glanbia group with a revenue ambition of $2bn in 2020. We are a values led organisation focused on driving sustainable business performance. Join us on our journey today! Glanbia Performance Nutrition (GPN) is headquartered in Dublin, ROI, with operating facilities in Illinois, California, South Carolina, Florida, the UK, the Netherlands, and Australia. GPN employs more than 1,800 people globally and has revenues of approximately $1.5B. With our ambition comes an exciting change management, culture, talent, organization development and engagement agenda in Asia. This role is responsible for creating working environments where our people can meet their full potential, while also delivering the potential for our brands. With a primary focus on our the Commercial and Marketing teams in the Asia business, the appointee will also lead a HR generalist role based in Melbourne, Australia, which sits on the Oceania Leadership Team. The role will lead all aspects of the people agenda, with a geographic scope covering the people agenda across Japan, South Korea, Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, Philippines, Australia and New Zealand. With our growth aspirations in the market comes the opportunity for the appointee to grow their role over time to a broader level of HR support and leadership, both geographically and functionally. The appointee will also have the scope to shape and contribute to our global agenda, through their role on the EMEA/ASPAC HR Leadership Team. As a result, the chosen candidate will need to show the potential to grow with the business over time. This is an end to end HR role, and the HR shared service functions are still in development, so this role requires the flexibility to drive the strategic agenda as well as the operational agenda. The opportunity where you will make an impact: Partner with the Asia Leadership Team to develop a purpose driven, values led culture that enables high performance. Coaching the Oceania BP to deliver the people agenda in ANZ. As a member of the Asia Leadership team, contribute to the shaping of the overall strategy for the markets. Develop and deliver an inspiring people strategy to support the business strategy, including a focus on Inclusion, Wellbeing and our Values. Coach and support the General Manager to build a high-performing Leadership Team. Coach and mentor the Leadership Team members, in support of high performance and their leadership effectiveness. Bring a deep understanding of the “pulse” of the organisation to the Leadership Team and inspire leadership accountability for employee engagement. Partner with Hiring Managers and Talent Acquisition to source high quality talent. Work with the leadership team to identify talent / high potential employees and build appropriate career plans and strategic succession planning. Partner with COEs and the broader HR team to (1) deploy global initiatives and (2) to influence the development of global initiatives, in service of the Asia and Oceania businesses. Lead the thinking on organisation effectiveness and operating models, to deliver the structure & capabilities required to deliver the strategy. Together with line managers, identify the training needs of those in the team and decide how to deliver the most appropriate learning interventions. Provide advice and support to Managers in order to resolve employee relations issues across all countries and proactively driving high performance in the teams. Development of contemporary benefits and policies to support talent attraction and retention. Engage and educate managers to ensure active management of all performance issues through informal and formal processes. Facilitate appropriate training for line managers and update them on legislative developments. Support employees and managers through the performance management process, ensuring process and best practice is followed. Take up projects in support of wider HR agenda, collaborating with the teams in the wider Glanbia group. Key Challenges and Success Measures: Achievement of key projects set by the HR VP and in conjunction with the LTs. Effectively deliver against HR and business agenda on agreed strategic priorities across the commercial functions. Effective optimisation of HR Processes, policy and service delivery and effective use of the HR systems. Effective support on change and transformation within the business and providing pro-active partnering to the line managers in the business. What you will bring to GPN: A track record in a fast paced, commercial environment through 5+ years as a HR BP, and the ability to be successful in a matrix organisation with multiple stakeholders, across diverse cultures. The agility and flexibility to adapt to a changing agenda over time, underpinned by the ability to create excitement for a long-term people strategy. Proven track record of broad HR operational delivery including operational excellence, talent acquisition, employee relations, performance, change management, org re-design and reward. A track record of providing coaching and mentoring support to stakeholders. Demonstrated success in identifying innovative people solutions, and then deploying the solution. Strong business acumen with ability to translate business and HR needs into action. The ability to build effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Excellent interpersonal skills coupled with a high level of professionalism and a proven track record in influencing senior stakeholders. Proven organisational skills with the ability to manage own work load. Employee relations experience across geographies. Degree/ Masters and CIPD qualified. What we would like to offer you: The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement! Our Smart Working model advocates wellbeing by providing you with a greater choice in how you work and live, giving you a better work-life balance. Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our GPN products! Applications for this position close on 1st February 2022. At Glanbia, we celebrate diversity, because we know that our individual strengths make us stronger together. We welcome and encourage interest from a wide variety of candidates, and we will give your application consideration, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, or disability status. At Glanbia our culture will celebrate individuality, knowing that together we are more.

Site Reliability Engineers (Development) Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is an engineering discipline that combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant systems. SRE is responsible for the availability and reliability of our firm's most critical platform services, and ensures they meet the requirements of our internal and external users. We look for engineers who are motivated to collaborate with our businesses to build and run sustainable production systems, which can evolve and adapt to changes in our fast-paced, global business environment. The Position: Direct exposure to best-in-class Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team, disciplines and tooling Adhere to and drive incident management process and support a blameless post-mortems culture. Develop, support, improve & administer the Firm's primary business-critical trading infrastructure Create and support automation tooling to improve the reliability of the platform and to increase the productivity of the team. Provide critical day-to-day support for a massive scale, distributed system Assess monitoring & alert signals to determine impact and risk to the business and contribute to the incident management process The successful candidate will have outstanding verbal and written communications, a natural ability to learn in a fast-paced environment, and will be a self-starter with plenty of initiative. The Candidate: Proficient in at least one programming language Ability to handle multiple on-going assignments and be able to work independently in addition to contributing as part of a highly collaborative and globally dispersed team Strong analytical skills with the ability to break down and communicate complex issues, ideas and solutions Willingness to learn new languages and programming paradigms (functional programming for example) Previous experience in a blameless SRE environment would be a plus Previous Linux exposure or willingness to learn Good to have Degree in computer science or engineering, or equivalent industry experience Works effectively and thrives in a team while able to operate independently, self-motivation is essential Strong verbal and written communication skills For more information you can email Ganjapan Chamsaeng in our Singapore office on ganjapan.chamsaeng@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 524085 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/wCeZIC/site-reliability-engineers-development-itcommunications-singapore-singapore-14806492 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA License No. 10C4544

Responsible for a specific location, department or product, our teams drive marcom strategy - from making budget recommendations to defining roadmaps and informing content themes. Interacting directly with customers and utilizing third-party customer data, they provide Dell's product marketing and messaging team with game-changing feedback. At the highest level, they develop and drive marketing policies and activities, from market research through brand management and product development to pricing. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Data Analyst on our Global Marketing team in Beijing/Dalian. Key Responsibilities Acts as subject-matter expert on business processes of assigned area Interfaces with business areas to provide solutions and tools to build and strengthen business processes. Works with customers to define business requirements while designing, developing and testing moderately complex knowledge capture processes and engineer elaborate workflows, search capabilities and measurement approaches. If you want to play a driving role in shaping marcom strategy for ground-breaking products, this is your opportunity to develop with Dell. Here's our story now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We're proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What's most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We started with computers, but we didn't stop there. Join us and become a part of what's next in technology, starting today. Job Description : The Role The core asset of a successful organization is its employees. At Recruit Express, we are in an expansion phase to strengthen our organization by hiring the best talent out there. We're seeking to bring in a Talent Acquisition Specialist that would be a key enabler for this growth. The Talent Acquisition Specialist would be the key conduit to identify the right talent by applying effective recruitment methodologies, and aligning hiring decisions with organizational goals. You will also be providing input into the overall hiring strategy of the organization to ensure the staffing needs of the company are being met with a long-term talent strategy in mind. This role requires a candidate with excellent communication and interpersonal skills as you'll often be working closely with leaders across different departments in Singapore and beyond in the region. A Career Path That Is Both Meaningful And Growth-Oriented Of all the things that can boost emotions, motivation, and purpose during a workday, the one most important is making progress in meaningful work. We pride ourselves on our team culture where leaders and mentors are invested in your career growth and we celebrate everyone's successes. As we continue our international expansion, there are unparalleled opportunities for growth - meaning that you will never stay stagnant. Indeed, you will find yourself constantly learning and growing with us. Isn't there anything more meaningful than such career growth? Job Responsibilities Devise and implement sourcing strategies to build pipelines of potential applicants, such as employer branding initiatives Manage the applicant flow, promote employee referrals, and use your creativity to effectively position our brand to attract talents. Form close relationships with hiring managers to ensure clear candidate/interviewer expectations Improve and guide new hires through the on-boarding program Organize company events and participate in campus outreach Required Skills Min. From recruiting to on-boarding, our clients enjoy a process-driven, human-centric approach to recruiting and access to a network of top-tier professionals. For the past 20 years, we have enjoyed phenomenal growth. The Recruit Express Group of Companies is a valuable member of the publicly listed HRnetGroup on the Singapore Stock Exchange (SGX: CHZ). At present, we have close to 1,000 employees in the Asia region operating in 13 large cities, and place out more than 40,000 contractor employees every year. The heartbeat of Recruit Express lies in our highly enthusiastic and driven business leaders and recruiters, who are motivated to make a difference in their own career as well as the careers of others. It is our people who had shaped the organisation's culture as a vibrant, nurturing and highly collaborative environment. We celebrate every small win and personal milestone of our people every day. Job_Title: VP / AVP, Development Lead (API / Microservices), Group Technology
Job_Descriptions: VP / AVP, Development Lead (API / Microservices), Group Technology VP / AVP, Development Lead (API / Microservices), Group Technology Posting Date: 18-Jan-2022 Location: Alexandra Road, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities The incumbent is responsible for all aspects of software delivery and release for applications in the external API domain. Applications include the API Gateway (Axway) as well as microservices (Java Springboot) for payments and consent. Work with a team of subject matter experts, architects and software developers to deliver projects and change requests via in-house development or vendor (Axway). Manage business stakeholders expectation and establish best or alternative solutions that are feasible within the technology and timeline constraints Review solution design and effort estimates from the team and prioritize projects and change requests assigned to the team Manage delivery of initiatives - projects and change request. Responsible for planning, manage vendor and in-house development, solutioning, implementing and maintaining software applications systems. Job Requirements Bachelor Degree in Computer Science / Engineering Hands-on experience and deep technical knowledge and skills in the following technologies: API Gateway (preference for Axway API Gateway, other products can be considered) Groovy / Javascript API Portal (preference for Axway API Portal, other products on Joomla can be considered) Middleware (IBM MQ, Connect Direct, Control-M) Java (Springboot, Camel, JBoss application server) Infrastructure (Linux, databases including Oracle, Cassandra and MariaDB) Security (SSL, JWT, JKS, OAuth, SAML, Threat Protection, Cryptography, WS-Security) DevOps (Bitbucke, Jenkins, SonarQube, VeraCode, TOSCA,) Experience in Integration Architecture API Lifecycle (API Definition, Implementation and Testing, API Publication, API Consumption and AIP Operational Metrics) Experience in an Application Development role for large/complex projects involving multiple technologies; experience with container-based technology (e.g. OpenShift) is a plus Experience in project Software Development Methodology - initiation, planning, tracking, requirement analysis, design, development, testing, implementation on open systems Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment A strong and assertive communicator in speaking and writing Resolving and influencing the positive outcome of conflicting objectives and priorities Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. Job_Title: Head of Market and Liquidity Risk (Digital Bank)
Job_Descriptions: This newly created Head of Market and Liquidity Risk role will cover a broad range of items associated with International Asset and Liability Management including interest rate risk and foreign exchange risk. Our client is one of the fastest growing financial institution in the region which manages a wide range of portfolio globally. With their creativity and various exciting platforms, they have been ensuring that technology becomes a key enabler for their operations in order to provide a seamless customer experience. Description Reporting to the CRO, the Head of Market and Liquidity risk will be involved in:- Crafting and setting up the market and liquidity risk management framework, policies and processes for the bank. Working closely with the treasury team to formulate liquidity management strategies such as liquidity risk management, capital cost and capital adequacy requirements. Monitoring market risk to ensure that they are within market risk thresholds, limits and constraints. Preparing relevant reports to senior management. Profile To qualify, the potential Head of Market and Liquidity Risk should meet the following criteria:- A recognised Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Finance or a related field. At least 10 years of relevant experience from the financial industry in market and liquidity risk management . Strong knowledge in the foreign exchange markets and international financial markets. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Devan Nanthacumar on +65 6416 9879.

Job_Title: Senior Customer Success Manager - Opportunity for Working Remotely
Job_Descriptions: Posting Title: Senior Customer Success Manager, Singapore/ South East Asia Internal Title: Senior Customer Success Manager (P5) Business Summary Ready to build? So are we. Join VMware's Modern Applications Business Unit (MAPBU) team, made up of products and services under the Tanzu portfolio to help customers build, run, and manage their most important applications. We build applications with velocity to run in a cloud-native environment, run open-source Kubernetes with consistency, and manage our customer's entire footprint with confidence to help them achieve their business outcomes. Job Overview The VMware MAPBU (aka. VMware Tanzu) is seeking a Senior Customer Success Manager (CSM) to drive a program of success and growth for key strategic customer accounts. The Customer Success Manager owns the Customer Lifecycle for a defined set of highly valued customers, beginning with product/services implementation & customer onboarding, through enablement, usage, adoption to renewals achievement, with the ambitious goal of retaining customers for life. A successful CSM builds impactful relationships and is highly skilled at navigating the customer network, achieving the trusted advisor and customer advocate statuses with key contact points. The CSM owns and works closely with VMware Sales Teams in designing and executing customer success plans to ensure customer objectives are met, and carry accountability for customer renewals, expansion & customer health -- outcomes driven directly by the CSM's work with his/her customer set. This individual should be a highly motivated, strategic thinker who can guide, inspire, coach, and mentor customers & colleagues, but who is also capable and willing to get deeply involved in day-to-day (at times, mundane) tasks. In addition to focusing on the customer experience and securing renewals, the Customer Success Manager must also have a long-term perspective and vision as the trusted advisor and strategic escalation point for existing customers. "Customers for life" is the ultimate goal. Responsibilities Owns overall customer strategy development and execution including both external and internal cooperation & communications. Drive forward the customer lifecycle to ensure customers and VMWare Tanzu's mutual success. Take full accountability of owned accounts in all aspects: Anticipating customer needs and proactively addressing them throughout the customer lifecycle, demonstrating lead time awareness, ensuring a frictionless renewals process, and ultimately positioning owned accounts for growth. Collaborate with internal & external stakeholders to build and manage Success Plans to aid the customer in achieving their goals & objectives with the Tanzu Product Suite, both short & longer terms. Ensure timely and successful customer on-boarding, enablement, and training to help customers realize the business value of the VMware Tanzu partnership and offerings. Deliver customers to the contract renewal cycle in a successful state by owning the renewals process to maximize customer retention & satisfaction. Synthe disparate observations and data to provide an objective assessment of account health, and proactively take action to improve account health score as part of the renewals strategy. Maintain customer satisfaction by engaging the right VMware teams, removing roadblocks and advocating in support of customers interest, while maintaining the company's interest to derive win-win outcomes. Help to identify, generate and facilitate incremental revenue opportunities & engaging the sales team to close additional commercial opportunities. Guide and support customers through the organizational changes needed to unlock the full value of the cloud, and help them staff, train, and align their people and partners to deliver on their cloud transformation. Partner with Services teams to jointly develop services plans, and overall services alignment, to drive appropriate levels of enablement and adoption for long term growth and consumption of products Assist with support escalation to ensure critical, business impacting issues are organized and resolved as quickly as possible Key Skills: Communication: Ability to understand and communicate technical concepts and business value to business stakeholders, up to and including executive leadership. Delivers clear messages when speaking using appropriate verbal and nonverbal communication Facilitation and presentation skills comfortable up to executive leadership and large group settings Initiative and Problem Solving: Actively seeks solutions to problems before being asked or directed. Able to exercise good judgment by making timely and effective, well-informed decisions. Experience working under deadlines and multiple projects Ability to use negotiation skills to constructively resolve differences and ensure an integrated solution is presented to the client Analytical and conceptual thinking Teamwork: Collaboration and effectiveness working in a cross-practice forum Adaptable and flexible: Ability to adapt to changing work environments, work priorities and organizational needs. Alignment with VMware's core values of Qualifications: Master or Bachelor degree in business administration, computer science, software engineering, or similar field of study preferred 10+ years of experience in customer success, program management, and/or equivalent Proficiency and knowledge of the cloud-native SDLC, demonstrated command of technical concepts and agile practices. Deep technical acumen & sharp business acumen Previous experience with SaaS based solutions. In-depth experiences working with government organizations a definite plus Demonstrated willingness to aggressively learn new things Location: Singapore Sales: VMware's Sales team focuses on two primary goals: helping customers solve their biggest business problems and hitting our bookings targets to keep our company growing and strong. We begin by forging deep relationships with our customers, so we can truly understand their business challenges and opportunities. We help drive their digital transformation by bringing VMware solutions that provide the speed, agility, and efficiency needed to compete and grow in the Internet economy. We also try to make the world a better place by hosting and participating in community activities. Are you inspired by the chance to solve your customers biggest challenges? You can make that kind of difference with VMware's portfolio of industry-leading solutions. Join our team, and you can grow your career and share in the success of an industry pioneer that's turning companies into truly digital enterprises. VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what's possible today at http://careers.vmware.com. Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

DESCRIPTION Job summary Do you have a passion to install, deploy, service and maintain mission critical IT infrastructure in one of the world's largest and fastest-growing cloud data centers? Are you looking to expand your horizon in an exciting and dynamic work environment that encourages creativity and boundless opportunities for career development? Do you enjoy solving problems and delivering value-adding results? If you answered yes to any of these questions, then Amazon Web Services Data Center is the place to be! This role is a unique opportunity to work in some of the most cutting edge data centers in the world. Amazon data centers are large-scale high-density centers where you will be working on changing the face of Cloud technology in the region. You will be assigned as an intern where you will have exposure to learn and understand how our Data Center works, interact with our support teams and customers. Experience the latest technologies of our cloud that puts you among top talents of data center technical support teams. As an intern, your progression will be evaluated to see if you have what it takes to join our successful team and be a full time Amazonian. Responsibilities There is never a dull moment as each day presents itself with different challenges. Some of the key responsibilities you will be trained on are: . Perform Data Center Servers and Network systems installation and configurations . Perform hardware diagnostics and troubleshoot all Systems hardware and Network related problems . Perform intermediate level Linux OS troubleshooting . Perform intermediate level Network configuration troubleshooting . Perform replacement of internal and external hardware parts of Servers and Network devices . Perform storage media (HDD, SSD etc.) sanitization and destruction tasks . Maintain a high level of system reliability by prioritizing resolution of trouble tickets efficiently . Work with multiple internal teams (DC operations, DC Engineering, Logistics, Security, Projects etc.) and be a good team player . Work with external/3rd party vendors and contractors to achieve organization needs . Adhere to DC operations, Logistics, Security and Safety related processes and guidelines . Practice and enforce Amazons Security and Safety best practices . Share ideas and contribute in projects to improve DC work environment and to improve DC operational efficiencies . Participate, lead and deliver small to mid-scale projects including Data Center rollout . Understands operational metrics and drive actions to achieve the targets . This is a opportunity where the candidate will work with local and/or global Data center teams as needed. . . As a Data Center Technician Intern, he/she will be working with Site stationed DCO, DCEO, Logistics and Security team to support small and Large scale projects and support activities like DC Audits (Rack, Server, parts etc), cycle counts etc. . . He/She also will be working on Software development projects for Singapore Infrastructure teams BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . In pursuit of obtaining an Electrical & Electronics, Computer Engineering, Information & Digital Technologies diploma or certification and expected to graduate in 2022 . Passionate about IT infrastructure and hardware . Basic knowledge of system hardware and network concepts & devices . Having troubleshooting experience is a plus . Good written & verbal communication and team player skills . Basic knowledge of data centers and cloud computing technologies and services PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Familiar with Linux operating system . Experience of server operation system level development, familiar with server hardware components and basic troubleshooting . Experience of networking setup and configuration . Knowledge of programming language i.e. Python, Perl, Shell Scripting is a plus but not a must Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Independent, self-motivated and willing to go the extra mile when needed . Ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment . Strong business awareness and customer focus . Integrity in all business dealings . Teamwork & Trust . Continuous learning . Professionalism and enthusiasm Desirable Requirements . Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We're proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What's most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. Job_Title: Engagement Manager - Cloud Enablement Skilling & Transformation
Job_Descriptions: DESCRIPTION At Amazon we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally bright, talented and driven people. Would you like to be part of a team focused on growing Amazon Web Services by managing skilling change programs to enable our largest customers? Do you have the business savvy, strong organizational change skills and ability to collaborate across multiple business units? Are you interested in establishing Amazon Web Services as the premier cloud provider by rolling out large scale cloud fluency transformation programs? If so, this is the role for you. As an AWS Skills Guild Engagement Manager, you will have the exciting opportunity to be part of a growing team, developing and delivering large scale cloud enablement transformation programs across the Asia, Pacific, Japan (APJ) region. You will work with some of AWS biggest and most complex customers to deliver multiple transformative change programs centered on cloud fluency and skilling. You will collaborate with field sales and training & certification teams to design skilling change programs develop project management processes and reporting mechanisms for the program report on the progress of these programs and drive customer satisfaction by providing creative solutions to complex questions. Successful candidates will have a strong professional consulting and organisational change management background, coupled with project management skills and a demonstrated passion for enabling and transforming customer's organisations. You will be a passionate, data driven and proven leader with the ability to gain customer stakeholder buy-in, communicate confidently at both the executive and project team level, and collaborate with a wide range of technical and non-technical teams, regardless of organisational boundaries. You will be a natural problem solver with a cool head, which can deal with ambiguity and work autonomously to drive the right outcomes for your customers across APJ. Roles & Responsibilities . Partner with customer and sales team to define, develop and implement skills transformation change programs . Take ownership of all project management activities for each Skills Guild engagement including planning, reporting and risk mitigation. Ensuring customer outcomes and milestones are delivered on time and to the requisite level of quality . Partner with AWS Account Managers and Solution Architects to directly support key customers with their program management needs, where needed, develop program management tools and documents for customer and AWS . Use a data driven approach to define metrics and reporting mechanisms that will ensure the quality of all customer engagements . Become a subject matter expert and educate account managers and customers on best practices for running large scale enablement projects . Craft monthly business reviews to AWS leadership to surface key business insights from the field and advocate for our customers . Opportunity to lead change and spearhead projects that will transform the AWS customer experience BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Basic Qualifications . 7+ years of relevant experience delivering complex business and/or organisational transformation projects 7+ years in a customer facing role 5+ years in professional consulting . Bachelor's degree in science, technology, engineering, math, human capital, or equivalent experience . Demonstrated ability to develop project management processes and reporting mechanisms . Proven record of delivering engagements greater than $1m . Extremely strong written and verbal communication skills . Proven ability to work in an ambiguous environment . High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple competing priorities . Superior analytical skills including but not limited to, enhanced Excel, Tableau and Power BI . Functional knowledge, including but not limited to strategy, business development, organisational change management, process improvement, sales enablement and marketing PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Preferred Qualifications . Training & certification / learning & development business experience . Knowledge of cloud services . Organisational Change Management certification / experience (eg Prosci) . Senior Qualitative Researcher Overview : A leading Tech company requires a Senior Qualitative Researcher to collaborate with its global team to drive and improve a leading Health product in Singapore. Our client is embarking upon an exciting nationwide initiative to value-add to and upgrade its one-of-a-kind health application in Singapore and is looking for a senior qualitative researcher for a mission critical role. The right candidates will be excellent communicators, knowledgeable about product development and design, curious about the relationship between technology and work, comfortable in a fast-moving organisation, excited to collaborate, and passionate about understanding and helping people. If this sounds like you, come join us as we work to solve complex and meaningful problems! Responsibilities : Work closely with product teams to identify research initiatives. Design hypotheses and lead studies that examine both user behaviour and attitudes. Generate actionable insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate design / product experiences. Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative methods Conduct semi-structured interviews Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways. Act as a thought leader in the domain of research, while advocating for the people who could use our products. Work closely with cross-functional partners (product management, data science, analytics, business, design, engineering, etc.) to identify and prioritize knowledge gaps in our understanding of the user experience and design research that uniquely contributes to solving for those knowledge gaps. Skill/Experience/Education: 3-5 years experience in product/market research or consultancy. Ability to create a research plan including logical formulation of a research hypothesis. Ability to ask, as well as answer, product and user experience related questions. Experience with a range of qualitative methods including but not limited to interviews, contextual inquiry, concept testing, and diary studies. Ability to handle complex information and adapt to a changing environment. Basic understanding of quantitative, behavioral analysis and statistical concepts. Ability to communicate research results to cross-functional stakeholders with data storytelling, presentation slides, and storytelling. Job Description : This role is part of the digital services team at Siemens Singapore. This role is customer facing and works in alignment with the digital services hub team and regional management to deliver digital transformation engagements with industrial customers, utilizing co-creation techniques and drilling down technological roadmaps into viable and practically implementable projects. The main goal for this role is to ensure customer success and satisfaction with Siemens technology and service by developing new use cases, customized or scalable solutions and thinking outside the box to connect the various dots. You will be part of a digital service team ecosystem which works across the value chain of different industries and provide customers with technology as a service. Your Role . Business development: responsibility for opportunity funnel build out and quota achievement through a combination of direct involvement and facilitation through the extended sales organization. . Sales Process: generate new leads, identify and qualify opportunities, position Siemens Digital services and close the business . Inspire our manufacturing customers to leverage digital technology and new innovative approaches throughout their digitalization journey. . Collaborate with business development and sales teams to identify and generate opportunities related to Digital Transformation. . Develop digital business strategies and plans for our customers. . Develop and present digital transformation roadmaps, define projects and implementation and integration recommendations that best match with the customer's existing environment and that meet customer expectations. . Promote and position the solutions of the digital services portfolio to customers in an ‘as-a-Service model. . Collaborate with our proposal engineers to create customer quotes. . Orchestrate project execution together with our CS project managers. . Create market and financial analysis to support the strategic and technical recommendations. . In case of customer specific development needs, collaborate with the technical team to define prototypes and proof of concepts. . Collaborate with project managers, integration engineers, software engineers, and other team members throughout the project phase. Job Requirements: . 8-10 years of outstanding sales performance. Ideally, you have acquired that experience from a system integration firm or a renowned industrial company with focus on manufacturing. . Bachelor's or Masters degree in engineering or business management with acquired digital technology expertise. . Experience in manufacturing oriented digital and IT project delivery in a variety of industries such as Electronics, Food & Beverage, etc . Experience with manufacturing execution systems, lean manufacturing, digital plants, computer-integrated manufacturing, manufacturing operations management, analytics, and AI. . Proven track record and expertise in the application of advanced manufacturing technology, including digital and big data (e.g., Smart Factory, IoT, Industry 4.0, additive manufacturing, artificial intelligence, blockchain). . Understanding of solution and enterprise architecture and standards (e.g. ISA95). . Excellent analytical and conceptional skills and an entrepreneurial mindset. . Excellent communication and listening skills. . Ability to work independently in a complex and matrixed organization, team player attitude being both able to lead a virtual team, as well as being an individual contributor. . High level of social competence and team spirit, ideally with past international exposure. . Self-driven and highly motivated hands-on mentality/leadership traits. Vision: Want to join a company on the cutting edge of technology and travel? Want to be part of a fantastic and fun company that’s revolutionizing the online travel advertising space? Specializing in traveler path-to-purchase data for over a decade, Sojern is travel's direct demand engine for thousands of brands -- from global enterprises to boutique operators -- across the hotel, airline, cruise, transportation, tourism industries, and more. Analyzing the world's travel intent signals with its proprietary data science methods, the company delivered $10B in generated bookings for its clients to date by activating multi-channel branding and performance solutions on the Sojern Traveler Platform. Recognized on the Top Company Cultures list by Entrepreneur Magazine, Sojern is headquartered in San Francisco, with teams based in Dubai, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Mexico City, New York, Omaha, Paris, Singapore, and Sydney. Who we are: Sojern is a team of passionate travel and technology enthusiasts building travel’s leading performance marketing engine. Through the Sojern Traveler Platform and billions of traveler intent signals across online and mobile channels, we put more heads in beds and travelers in towns for our clients worldwide. Due to our focus on customer success, we have earned the distinction as the fastest growing travel technology company on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500 for 5 years in a row. The Role: Are you a team player, eager to work hard, and do you like a fast paced/fun and challenging work environment?  If this sounds like you, come be a part of an exciting growing team and company!  As a Campaign Coordinator at Sojern you would play an integral part of an advertising campaign's journey!  Campaign Coordinators work with and support Sojern's internal teams across the globe!  The Campaign Coordinator at Sojern plays a critical role in our Business Strategy & Operations organization. The Campaign Coordinator is partnering with Account Managers, Analysts, and other internal teams within ad operations to ensure advertising campaigns are successfully launched and continually perform to clients’ goals. To thrive, you must work well with people, be comfortable using data and making data driven decisions, have a well-rounded business skill set, and be willing to jump in and work hard. This role is the first part of a development program where you will build a foundation of knowledge in the digital marketing landscape. You will transition into focusing heavily on data and running campaigns in a live environment. This is a great opportunity to start getting valuable online marketing experience and a great stepping stone to start working at Sojern. We take pride in providing an outstanding work environment and pledge to provide you with real world online marketing and data analysis experience. Responsibilities: Coordinate with ad operations to ensure campaigns are successfully launched by uploading creatives, creating pixels and troubleshooting technical problems. Work directly with Sojern Account Managers and Analysts on daily workload needs. Demonstrate an interest in data and digital marketing. Investigate and solves data driven problems. What you bring to the table: Highly developed computer skills with experience using MS Excel, MS Powerpoint, and Google applications. Bachelors in Business, Advertising, Marketing or related field. (Business Intelligence & Analytics, Economics, and Finance a plus) Experience in problem solving, identifying trends and formulating recommendations. Excellent communication, organization and attention to detail. Capability to manage projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Proven track record of exceeding expectations. Languages skills preferred, particularly the following: Mandarin, Thai, Bahasa (Indonesia), Cantonese, Korean, Japanese Perks: Culture: Strong core business values, focus on teamwork, vibrant, social and fun environment Snacks: Variety of snacks in the office Opportunities: Be part of a growing team with training and support to help you grow Give Back: We give 40 hours a year to volunteer and organize office volunteer programs with local organizations Ownership: Lead innovative and challenging projects Competitive Localized Benefits Time off: 20 vacation days per annum At Sojern, we work to create a brave space that seeks out, embraces, and promotes diverse thoughts, beliefs, and experiences of Sojernistas globally. We are building a workforce that represents the customer base we are serving and the world we live in. A diversified workforce is an innovative workforce. Just as there is no one archetype traveler, there is no one archetype employee. We foster diversity and inclusion across the company, actively seeking to amplify underrepresented voices and apply diverse perspectives to ensure products, policies, and programs are relevant for our employees and clients alike. Embracing our differences and celebrating them moves us towards our goal of making travel inclusive of all. Sojern has over 15 employee-led Affinity Groups, including Embrace Inclusion, So-Proud, Sojern Women's Group, Sojern Gives Back, and more, which are the core of our culture, fostering belonging, inspiring learning, and creating opportunities for all Sojernistas across the globe. At Sojern, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender orientation, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Risk Management (GRM) is an independent function responsible for ensuring that risk management practices at OCBC Bank are effective and comprehensive. GRM builds and drives the Bank's businesses through an integrated risk management approach relying on strong risk analytics to support strategic business decision-making and to create a competitive edge for the Group. This position will be sitting in the Operational Risk Management department of GRM. Purpose of the role The Fraud MIS Head is focused on strengthening Group Fraud Risk Management (FRM) capabilities in fraud detection, fraud prevention and fraud response, through developing and deploying machine learning models, and providing insights into performance of the Group's fraud detection systems and processes using data analytics. The incumbent is expected to: Lead and play an active role in the development and deployment of machine learning models to strengthen capabilities of the Fraud Surveillance System (FSS) and Anti-financial Malware System (AFMS); Provide leadership and guidance on the use data analytics to increase the value and effectiveness of both the FSS and AFMS, and to recommend for parameter changes, where necessary; Actively participate in the deployment of future phases of the FSS and AFMS in the Group; Understand the latest fraud trends, detection techniques and machine learning models, with a view to integrate into the Group's fraud detection systems. Key Responsibilities Work closely with FRM and their partners to understand current and emerging fraud trends. Maintain a deep and thorough understanding of the capabilities of the FSS and AFMS. Develop, deploy and maintain machine learning models for detection of suspected fraudulent transactions. Lead the MIS team in monitoring the performance and effectiveness of the FSS and AFMS by applying statistical techniques to identify opportunities to improve the performance of both systems. Based on the results of these analyses, create new rules or enhance the parameters of existing rules, after obtaining the appropriate approvals. Work closely with FRM to understand existing analytics and machine learning capabilities, and propose, develop and deploy such capabilities. Play a 'technical consultant' role and be recognized as a subject-matter-expert on fraud-related data analytics. Maintain a strong understanding of the range of fraud detection/prevention techniques and capabilities in the market, and share knowledge on the capabilities of other fraud monitoring systems, data analytics and operational models. Play an active role in relevant projects, which may be made up of participants within and outside of Operational Risk Management Corporate Security (ORM CS). Demonstrate a flexible approach to work, identifying and taking on the tasks which will add value to the roles and responsibilities of FRM. Conform to company's performance management policies and procedures. Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: Masters / Degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, economics, or other quantitative fields. At least 5 years of experience in data analytics preferably in the financial industry focusing on business intelligence analysis, data engineering, or related fields. Experience track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets. 1 to 3 years in practical fraud risk management roles would be an added advantage. Developed Machine Learning models would be a strong advantage. Experience in developing MIS reports and conducting analytics for system parameter changes. Must be able to speak, read, write and understand the primary languages used in the workplace. Additional language skills are advantageous for this post but not essential. Independent, resourceful and enthusiastic with a high sense of integrity. Systematic approach with good organization and planning skills. Advanced data analytics skills and knowledge in developing and deploying machine learning models. Advanced knowledge of big data technologies, SQL, Python, and in developing data models, ETL Development, and Data Warehousing. Proven success in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe data modelling and analytical decisions and data engineering strategy. Able and willing to work under intense pressure. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Business Analytics Lead, Digital & Transformation , Global Corporate Banking
Job_Descriptions: Business Analytics Lead, Digital & Transformation , Global Corporate Banking At Global Corporate Banking, we serve a diverse group of domestic and multinational corporations across a range of industries including government agencies, real estate, utilities, infrastructure, healthcare, technology, transportation, commodities and energy amongst others. We have dedicated relationship managers in offices across the world who provide comprehensive and personalised coverage to our clients through deep understanding of their activities and needs. We are looking for an individual with business analytics and storytelling experience in financial services to join the Digital & Transformation Office to help the businesses organise and wrangle valuable information from big data. The individual should be a self-starter, energetic and have a passion for both problem-solving and telling compelling stories using data to business leaders. He/she will also work closely with our colleagues from the Group's data analytics teams as well as Data Analysts and Product Owners of digital transformation projects to solidify Global Corporate Banking's data foundation, drive data-driven decision-making and directly impact divisional automation initiatives and customer experience. We require an individual with an agile and nimble mindset, good understanding of emergent industry tools and best practices in data automation for delivering solutions at a rapid pace. Responsibilities: Translate strategic priorities of Global Corporate Banking into measurable impactful goals to the data analytics team and clearly map out the analytical tools and approach to achieve it. Champion a culture of data-informed decision-making and advance our data capabilities across all business teams. Gather, synthesize and translate data requirements to serve business needs and our customers optimally, perform the required analytics using internal data, and augment it with external data, market data, credit data, partner data, digital data, etc. Make sense of data, analyze trends, draw out insights to explain or support hypotheses, build a story, propose and recommend the solution and next steps to address the business problem or opportunity. Manage day-to day deliverables against the agreed book of work, ensure service levels of the Analytics team are met, target milestones of the initiatives are achieved. Build, coach and mentor a team of Data Analysts to identify, define and solve high impact business problems by ensuring seamless execution, ensuring measurability and clear success metrics, and subsequently follow through on opportunity to optimize the campaigns Communicate effectively to senior stakeholders and present the insights that brought about the experimentation, the test design, the impact and results to the business Ensure clear and organized documentation of the end-to-end requirements to mount successful automated triggers, from basic business requirements, to logic creation, to grooming requirements, validation scenarios, test design, approvals signoffs and success metrics. Contribute to the division's data roadmap and lead the inclusion of lending, trade, deposits, investment banking, treasury and payments-related KPIs into business analytics use cases and outcomes Lead the migration of manual excel reports and dashboards to RM Workbench, build and maintain real-time or near real-time visualizations that helps our coverage teams digest the data and draw out trends and insights easily Leverage on the Enterprise Big Data Platform (EBP) in enhancing the end-to-end process of crafting lending and cross-sell solutions, lead the migration of the countries to a fully automated leads generation from eligibility to pricing assignment, with minimal manual intervention. Understand regulatory implications and develop mitigation and opportunity strategies Ensure robust quantity control in the analytical processes Cross functional leadership (communicating and influencing) to drive towards common goal *LI-JX Qualifications Qualifications: 7+ years of experience in financial services with a focus on Corporate/Institution/Transaction Banking Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field of work, with advance understanding and/or technical experience in SQL and data modelling tools (e.g. Python) Proven track record in strategic thinking, commercial awareness and the ability to frame business problems Excellent analytical, technical and/or statistical skills with proven ability to translate large volumes of data into meaningful narratives An influencer who communicates clearly and frequently to both technical analysts and non-technical business leaders Intellectually curious, consistently seeking and developing new opportunities autonomously Growth mindset - eager to learn and try new things, adapt and thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment

Job_Title: AVP, Policy (AML/CFT), Group Financial Crime Compliance - (210002JH)
Job_Descriptions: OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world’s most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody’s. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World’s Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance (GLRC) supports the Bank in all legal, regulatory and compliance matters. The division ensures that the Bank's businesses comply with policies, procedures and relevant laws, rules and regulations issued by Monetary Authority of Singapore and other local regulators. Apart from being a legal advisor on litigation, trademark filings and other legality issues where relevant, GLRC plays an important role as undertakers of the bank-wide regulatory compliance and anti-money laundering initiatives. This includes developing policies and procedures to manage and mitigate risks relating to money laundering and financing of terrorism, as well as monitoring, detection and combating of money laundering and financial crime activities. Key Responsibilities: Assist the Head Policy (AML/CFT) in the execution and implementation of Policy (AML/CFT) (“Policy”) work within GLRC AML. The scope of the Policy function includes AML/CFT and related Policies/Procedures, AML/CFT Projects and Products, Industry Projects, and supporting audits and regulatory inspections management. Understand the various policy and regulatory requirements in countries where OCBC operates and adopt requirements or practices that are robust to support the Group’s AML/CFT framework and program Responsible for Group AML/CFT policies and procedure creation, maintenance, and implementation. Ensuring that the Group AML/CFT policies and procedures are maintained, updated, and implemented timely. Conduct exercises required under the Group AML/CFT program for the Group (such as entity risk assessment, benchmark against regulations, etc). Assist with assessing ML/TF risks in new product approvals. Assist with preparing and updating compliance training materials and/or conduct trainings on AML/CFT areas. Prepare the submission of metrics for Senior Management Reporting. This also includes periodically refreshing and enhancing the reporting formats, KPIs, metrics, etc. Any other duties deem necessary by the Head of Policy (AML/CFT). Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: A university degree with at least 5 years’ experience in compliance and anti-money laundering/counter terrorism financing compliance (“AML”) with established financial institutions. Broad knowledge of business, operations and the AML/CFT regulatory framework in which bank groups operate. Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Strong communication (including written) and interpersonal skills. Ability to influence and work with multiple stakeholders across the business. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Personal Financial Consultant - Global Consumer Financial Services [2100012S]
Job_Descriptions: Personal Financial Consultant - Global Consumer Financial Services (Ind) - (2100012S) OCBC opens doors to new opportunities. Start your career with OCBC as a Personal Financial Consultant! At OCBC we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. As Singapore’s longest established local bank, we have a global network of more than 450 branches and representative offices in more than 15 countries and territories. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! Global Consumer Financial Services serves almost 3 million customers across Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and China. In Singapore, our customer proposition caters to different life-stages and needs, ranging from Mighty Savers for children and young families, FRANK by OCBC for youths and young working adults to OCBC Premier Banking for affluent individuals. Besides being the pioneer in various banking products and services which include FRANK by OCBC, full-service Sunday Banking and our award-winning Online Banking, we are also the market leader for Bancassurance sales. What is it like being a Personal Financial Consultant at OCBC? As a Personal Financial Consultant, you will be based at one of our island-wide Branches and will provide comprehensive, one-stop financial advisory services to customers through the active promotion and cross-selling of our full range of wealth management products that include insurance, loans, unit trusts and structured deposits. With an emphasis on consultative selling to meet customers’ needs, you will also proactively build and manage long-term customer relationship and provide good after-sales service to them. To help you succeed in your role, you will join our structured training program during the first 6 weeks of your career with us. Thereafter you will also have at least 5 training days every year to help you further develop your career and keep your skills sharp and up-to-date with the latest developments in the industry. As a successful Personal Financial Consultant, you will have the option to take your career forward by either pursuing our Management Route, on the path of becoming a Branch Manager one day, or the Sales Route, growing into a Senior Relationship Manager working with premier private clients. Plus, as a top performer, you will be invited to trips, visiting great locations across the world from Paris, Barcelona to London and many more. *LI-ZY Qualifications The successful candidate should be able to demonstrate the following selection criteria: Preferably has a Degree or a Diploma with at least 2 years of relevant retail banking sales experience. Results-oriented go-getter who works well under pressure. Prepared to have flexible working hours that may include working on weekends. Candidates with more than 2 years of relevant financial advisory experiences and  proven sales records will be considered for Senior Personal Financial Consultant position.
